Congratulations to PSJA Bus Driver Roel Uribe for being honored with the 2019-2020 PCAT Bus Driver of the Year Award!

#psjaproud
shared_text:
PSJA Transportation Department
Yesterday at 11:39 AM ·

PSJA Transportation Director, Fernando Guajardo, is honored in presenting Roel Uribe, bus driver, the 2019-2020 PCAT Bus Driver of the Year Awarded to Local Bus Driver. The Award was based upon multiple driver attributes: Leadership, Attitude, Perseverance, Student and Parent Relationships, and Technical Skill. In addition, Roel Uribe was also named as a PCAT Regional Bus Driver of the Year. A Special Plaque was issued for his honor. PSJA ISD PSJA Operations Division #PSJAISD #psjaoperations #PSJAFamily #PSJAstrongertogether

Did you know? We currently have 119 buses equipped with WiFi connectivity to provide internet for our students during distance learning.

Thank you to our amazing PSJA Operations Division, @PSJATransportation, and PSJA IT Departments for working together to help our students and families during these unprecedented times.

Parents, if you need support with internet access please notify your child's school or call us 956-354-2045.

#PSJAStrongerTogether

---------

¿Sabías? Actualmente contamos con 119 autobuses equipados con conectividad WiFi para brindar internet a nuestros estudiantes durante el aprendizaje virtual.

Gracias a nuestra increíble División de Operaciones de PSJA, @PSJATransportation y el Departamentos de TI por trabajar juntos para ayudar a nuestros estudiantes y familias durante estos tiempos dificiles.

Padres, si necesitan ayuda con el acceso a Internet, por favor notifique a la escuela de su hijo o llámenos al 956-354-2045.

#PSJAStrongerTogether

post_text:
We will be hosting free Back to School COVID-19 screenings at several locations through Sept. 25.

The testing will be provided by a private company through the Texas Department of Emergency Management, Department of State Health Services and the military to best serve our community.

Locations:
Sept. 14 - 19 at 9:00 am PSJA Southwest ECHS and RYMS
Sept. 21 - 25 at 9:00 am Audie Murphy MS and Farias Elementary

The free screenings will be a PCR Diagnostic Test, which consists of an oral swab. The tests will be administered indoors with a Decontamination Team deployed afterwards. All community members six years of age and older can be tested.

Those receiving the test will scan a code using their phone and will get results in one to five days via their cell phone. The test will be administered to anyone regardless of symptoms as a way to prepare for a safer return to in-person instruction
#PSJACares
text:
We will be hosting free Back to School COVID-19 screenings at several locations through Sept. 25.

The testing will be provided by a private company through the Texas Department of Emergency Management, Department of State Health Services and the military to best serve our community.

The free screenings will be a PCR Diagnostic Test, which consists of an oral swab. The tests will be administered indoors with a Decontamination Team deployed afterwards. All community members six years of age and older can be tested.

Those receiving the test will scan a code using their phone and will get results in one to five days via their cell phone. The test will be administered to anyone regardless of symptoms as a way to prepare for a safer return to in-person instruction

On this SuperChats episode, our Superintendent talks with our PSJA Child Nutrition Director Imelda Palacios and PSJA Operations Division Chief Nick Martinez about the tremendous behind-the-scenes efforts behind the weekly meal distributions for our families.

In addition to distributing meals at most PSJA schools this week and 11 sites via buses, our team is also going out of their way to deliver meals for those families without any access to transportation to ensure they get food.

#PSJAStrongerTogether

post_text:
Did you know? First launched in the Spring, the PSJA COVID-19 Hotline has now been expanded into a multi-team operation including additional campus nurses and assistance from additional medical experts to serve staff, students, and parents.

“We want to ensure that we are maintaining the safety and health of our entire PSJA Family,” said PSJA Superintendent Dr. Jorge L. Arredondo. “These collaborative measures are intended to streamline the process of identifying, communicating, and preventing further possible spread of COVID-19 cases. At PSJA, we were one of the first in the region to start a pandemic hotline to provide support during these uncertain times, and we recently hired a team of experts to support social and emotional needs of both students and staff as part of our new wraparound services.”

#PSJAStrongerTogether
shared_text:
PSJAISD.US
PSJA ISD expands COVID-19 Hotline, creates taskforce to prevent spread

At PSJA, we were one of the first in the region to start a pandemic hotline to provide support during these uncertain times, and we recently hired a team of experts to support social and emotional needs of both students and staff as part of our new wraparound services.”

post_text:
Today our PSJA Family honors all those who lost their lives 19 years ago on September 11, 2001.

While nothing can fill the void in the families who lost loved ones that tragic day, we gather virtually today as ONE PSJA Family to show our support, remember, and honor them.

Today’s 9-11 Remembrance Ceremony is even more special as despite the global pandemic disrupting our lives today, students and teachers from our high schools led by their Student Councils from
PSJA Early College High School, PSJA North Early College High School, @PSJA Southwest Early College High School, PSJA T. Jefferson T-Stem ECHS, PSJA Collegiate High School Program organized this beautiful virtual joint ceremony as ONE PSJA Family.

May God continue to watch over the loved ones who remain in our hearts today and always and forever bless America.

#PSJAStrongerTogether

post_text:
We recently hosted the first-ever PSJA ISD Virtual Parent Learning Academies where parents learned how to use Google Classroom and our Home Access Center to check their children's schedule and grades, among other topics.

These academies consisted of real-time engagement between parents and district staff and immediate questions answered within the live session.

“We will continue our Virtual Parent Learning Academies throughout the year,” said Garza. “We want to offer them at least once a week in the evening, as a bilingual session, so they can help their children in the morning or if they work. Upcoming topics will include Clever, iStation, and Google Meets. We are excited; this initiative will make a huge difference in our community. We connected with parents we had not reached before.”

ICYMI you can watch these sessions at www.psjasid.us/parentacademies.

#PSJAStrongerTogether
shared_text:
PSJAISD.US
Amid Social Distancing, PSJA ISD Virtual Parent Academies connect with over 22,000 parents

shared_text:
PSJA Counseling & Guidance Department
September 3 at 10:50 AM ·

It’s National Suicide Prevention Awareness Month. During these times of physical distancing, it may be harder to notice warning signs of suicide.

Some signs you can look for:
• No longer responding to calls and texts
• Changes in tone or language when talking, texting, or posting online
• Changes in the frequency and type of content shared online
• Changes in energy levels or appetite
• Increased use of substance abuse

If you or a loved one is experiencing a mental health crisis, help is available 24/7 through the National Suicide Prevention Life Line at 1-800-273 TALK (8255) for English 1-888-628-9454 for Spanish.

For more information about PSJA counseling services and resources contact our office @ (956) 354-2088 or campus counselor. We are here for You! You’re Not Alone 💜🤍❤️

post_text:
Congratulations to Belinda Ortiz, she recently got promoted as PSJA ISD's Wraparound Resource Specialist!

A graduate of the University of Texas-Pan American, where she obtained both her Bachelor's and Master's Degrees in Social Work, she has 15 years experience in the field and 5 years as an elementary teacher.

Her experience in social work includes working with youth and families as a Prevention Educator, Family Services Worker, Community Liaison, Investigative Social Worker and School Social Worker. Most recently, she was the School Social Worker and Truancy Officer at PSJA Elvis J. Ballew HS for the past 3 years.

"I am excited for the opportunity to continue working with the students and families of PSJA in a new role and direction with the development of the Social and Emotional Learning Program and Wraparound Student Support Services."

The Texas Workforce Commission has awarded our district with a $269,624 grant that will offer training and equipment to 140 students who are interested in pursuing careers in technical education!

Through the grant, the district will purchase equipment that can simulate what students would use in an auto mechanic shop to provide them with relevant hands-on experience to be successful in the field of their choosing.

Read more here: https://bit.ly/3hDMpuM

post_text:
Congratulations to Daleth Garcia, PSJA Early College High School Class of 2013 alumna, for graduating with a Masters in Educational Leadership from the University of North Texas!

Daleth has been part of the PSJA Family since elementary & was part of softball & theatre arts program during her high school years. She was also in National Honor Society, Distinguished Advanced Placement and graduated Top 10% of her class.

She has continued to be part of the PSJA Family as a teacher since 2017, has represented PSJA ISD presenting at RGV TABE, received PSJA's Spirit Award for Positive Engagement, & was currently promoted to a Collaborative Learning Leader at PSJA ISD's Augusto Guerra Elementary.

#PSJAFamily #PSJAStrongerTogether

shared_text:
PSJA Parental Engagement Program
August 24 at 4:32 PM ·

IMPORTANT/IMPORTANTE

Our Virtual Parent Academies will be streamed LIVE on our Facebook page at the scheduled times.

Parents, please don't click on links unless they come from us or PSJA ISD to watch these sessions. These sessions are free and we do not ask you to sign in, register or input any credit card information.

Please be vigilant and help us report any suspicious accounts asking for such information.
--------
IMPORTANTE
Nuestras Academias Virtuales para Padres se transmitirán EN VIVO en esta pagina durante los horarios programados.

Padres, no opriman enlaces a menos que provengan de nosotros para ver estas sesiones. Estas sesiones son gratuitas y no necesita registrarse o ingresar información de su tarjeta de crédito.

post_text:
Important information from South Texas College - Dual Credit for all students taking dual credit courses:

* ALL dual credit students (new and returning) must successfully complete the mandatory Online Student Blackboard Orientation.

* Orientation will be available on the student's Blackboard Platform (only the student will have access)
* Students must use their STC credentials to log in (same username and password as JagNet)

* Deadline to complete the Orientation is Friday, August 28th
Orientation has 5 modules and will take approximately 2 hours to complete

Students do not have to complete in one sitting.

#PSJAEarlyCollege

post_text:
Let's welcome Licensed Specialist in School Psychology (LSSP), Nellcy Garcia, to our PSJA Family. She is part of our new Social and Emotional Learning Support program available this school year.

Ms. Garcia has six years experience in the field of education. She obtained her undergraduate degree from UT-Pan American and her Master's Degree in School Psychology from UTRGV. She has both teaching and school psychology experience.

As a Licensed Specialist in School Psychology, she has helped students succeed academically, socially, and emotionally with specialized training in education and mental health. As an LSSP, she will provide services in the areas of prevention, consultation, evaluation, intervention, research, and planning.

Welcome to the PSJA Family! #PSJAStrongerTogether

post_text:
Making history, PSJA ISD hosted a Virtual Convocation on Monday, August 17, 2020 to welcome its nearly 5,000 employees for the 2020-2021 school year.

The event included special remarks from the School Board of Trustees, Superintendent Dr. Jorge L. Arredondo and featured a Keynote Address from UTRGV Professor and proud PSJA alum Dr. David Bowles.

“From teachers, principals and counselors to nurses, custodians, and bus drivers all of you will play a key role in the success of our students now more than ever. Our students are counting on us to lead the way and be there for them,” said PSJA School Board President Jorge Palacios. “As our theme says, we are STRONGER TOGETHER. And this could not ring more true as we get ready to face a new school year that will involve many firsts for everyone.”

#PSJAStrongerTogether
shared_text:
PSJAISD.US
PSJA ISD hosts first-ever Virtual Welcome Back Convocation

We will offer both virtual learning and face-to-face instruction for all students during the 2020-2021 school year. The first 8-weeks of school will be done 100% online.

Read the full plan here: https://www.psjaisd.us/Page/4555

For more information regarding back to school, please visit www.psjaisd.us/back2school

-----

Aqui esta la primera parte de nuestro Plan de Reapertura del Año Escolar 2020-2021!

PSJA ISD ofrecerá tanto aprendizaje virtual como instrucción presencial para todos los estudiantes durante el año escolar 2020-2021. Las primeras 8 semanas de clases se realizarán 100% en línea.

Vea el plan en español completo aqui: https://www.psjaisd.us/Page/4556

Para mas informacion sobre el regreso a clases, visite www.psjaisd.us/back2school

#PSJABack2School

post_text:
It’s back-to-school season, and what better way to prepare for your child’s new year than by joining us for our first ever VIRTUAL PSJA Back to School Expo happening August 18-20.

During our Expo, which you will be able to stream live from your child’s respective Campus Facebook page, you’ll be able to hear from your child’s principal, nurse, counselor and special programs representatives who will be able to answer any questions you may have LIVE. And if you can’t make it, no worries as every session will be recorded and shared online.

The Expo will be on Tuesday, August 18 for Middle Schools, Wednesday, August 19 for Elementaries and Thursday, August 20 for High Schools. On each day we’ll have an English session from 6:00 to 6:30 and a Spanish Session from 6:30 to 7:00 PM.

So stop by our VIRTUAL EXPO to get all your questions answered, and do so at the convenience of your home!

Please visit our website psjaisd.us/Expo for more information. We hope to see you there!

post_text:
In addition to input from students, parents, staff and community partners, PSJA ISD’s leadership appreciates the collaboration of partner The Holdsworth Center who assisted in documenting the process with full transparency, ensuring all voices were heard and captured to reflect the essence of PSJA during the development of the new Vision and Mission.

“I would also like to thank our dynamic school board for their leadership and support,” said Dr. Jorge L. Arredondo, Superintendent of Schools. “This was no easy task, in fact, it had not been done in almost two decades, but together as we celebrated our district’s Centennial, we saw the need to build a new vision and mission that corresponded with who we are today and where we want to be in years to come.”

#PSJAStrongerTogether
shared_text:
PSJAISD.US
PSJA ISD unveils new Vision, Mission to guide plans for the upcoming year, future work
text:
In addition to input from students, parents, staff and community partners, PSJA ISD’s leadership appreciates the collaboration of partner The Holdsworth Center who assisted in documenting the process with full transparency, ensuring all voices were heard and captured to reflect the essence of PSJA during the development of the new Vision and Mission.

“I would also like to thank our dynamic school board for their leadership and support,” said Dr. Jorge L. Arredondo, Superintendent of Schools. “This was no easy task, in fact, it had not been done in almost two decades, but together as we celebrated our district’s Centennial, we saw the need to build a new vision and mission that corresponded with who we are today and where we want to be in years to come.”

#PSJAStrongerTogether

PSJAISD.US
PSJA ISD unveils new Vision, Mission to guide plans for the upcoming year, future work

post_text:
To be used as the guiding tool for the upcoming school year and beyond, we recently unveiled our district’s new Vision and Mission developed during the 2019-2020 school year through a 6-month process that included extensive stakeholder input and feedback.

The PSJA School Board of Trustees officially adopted the final draft earlier this summer on June 22, 2020. The process, which started back in January, included numerous focus groups, surveys, and exchanges. Hundreds of thoughts and conversations were gathered, drafted, and revised until reaching the final product.

“We are thankful to our students, parents, staff members and community partners for joining us through this process,” said PSJA School Board President Jorge Palacios. “They clearly shared their priorities and expectations for the future of PSJA.”

#PSJAStrongerTogether

Congratulations to PSJA ISD educator Patricia Casas from Kelly-Pharr Elementary, who was named the 2020 Teacher of the Year by the Rio Grande Valley Texas Association for Bilingual Education (RGV TABE)!

“Congratulations to Ms. Casas for this accomplishment,” said PSJA Superintendent of Schools Dr. Jorge L. Arredondo. “We are honored to have amazing teachers like her educating our future. Her passion for learning is transferred to every student she teaches. We are blessed to have her as part of our PSJA Family!”

#PSJAProud #PSJAStrongerTogether

post_text:
Congratulations to PSJA Family Member Maria Rubio-Villescas for her recent promotion, she is the new Principal at Sgt. Leonel Treviño Elementary in San Juan!

Mrs. Rubio-Villescas has been part of the PSJA Family as a teacher at Palmer Elementary for 10 years and as an Assistant Principal at Carman Elementary for 7 years. She earned her Bachelor’s and Master’s Degree from the University of Texas-Pan American.

“I am truly honored and humbled to be given the opportunity to serve as Principal at Treviño Elementary. I believe my main responsibility is to put our teachers in the best possible position to succeed, as they will in turn put our students in the best possible position to succeed.”

Congratulations Mrs. Rubio-Villescas!

post_text: Congratulations!
shared_text:
PSJA Early College High School
August 5 at 2:44 PM ·

On August 5, 2020, the Rio Grande Valley Border Patrol sector recognized ten students across the RGV as “Youth of the Year” recipients with a virtual ceremony.

We are pleased to announce that our very own graduate, Claudia Quintana, now has the distinguished honor of being named as the 2019-2020 “Head of the Class” and “YOUTH OF THE YEAR” recipient. In addition to being recognized Claudia was also awarded a $3,000 Scholarship.

Congratulations Claudia! We are so proud of you here at PSJA Early College High School and wish you the very best of luck as you begin a new chapter in your life! #classof2020 #bearpride

We are pleased to announce that our very own graduate, Claudia Quintana, now has the distinguished honor of being named as the 2019-2020 “Head of the Class” and “YOUTH OF THE YEAR” recipient. In addition to being recognized Claudia was also awarded a $3,000 Scholarship.

post_text:
During today’s regular school board meeting of the PSJA Board of Trustees, an amended School Calendar for the 2020-2021 School Year was approved.

The first day of school will be Tuesday, Sept. 8, 2020. We will be hosting Virtual Enrichment Days for all grade levels from August 31 to September 4. We encourage all students to attend. They will participate in curriculum, technology and digital citizenship courses.

Teachers will start Monday, August 17, and have 8 days of Staff Development and 2 Workdays.

More information regarding virtual back to school expos and events will be shared soon.

Please see graphic for detailed calendar information. #PSJABacktoSchool #PSJAStrongerTogether

With hundreds of students participating in dozens of Google Classrooms, band members from each of our high schools, are working to ensure their favorite pastime is both effective and safe.

Similar to in-person practices, students and directors are able to see each other, catch up, share quarantine stories and continue to work toward their goals.

Parents in need of more information about the virtual band camps can reach out to their child's respective band director or email jon.taylor@psjaisd.us.

Read more here: https://bit.ly/31lj3e0

post_text: Move it Monday!
shared_text:
PSJA Health Services
August 3 at 5:47 PM ·

💪🏽MOVE IT MONDAY!👊🏽 We challenge you to complete 2-3 rounds of 30 second work/ 30 second rest on each of these exercises!💡 Did you know that pushing yourself through short period of INTENSE anaerobic exercise is a great way to promote your cardiovascular health?🙌🏼 The best part of this workout is that it is intense, short and enough to get our heart pumping to start the week! ⚡️♥️

post_text:
Thank you to the 40+ teachers who are part of the Superintendent Teacher Advisory Council for providing feedback regarding the new proposed school calendars.

All PSJA Staff will receive the link to vote for their preferred calendar later today. These proposed calendars include a delay in school due to the current spike in cases within our region. It also provides more training and planning days for our teachers and staff, as well as additional days for dissemination of resources to students.

More information to follow. Thank you to all who have participated in our Thoughtexchange poll and have provided feedback!

#PSJABacktoSchool

post_text:
Did you know? Results from the 2020 Census are used by federal, state and local officials to inform decisions on how to spend billions of dollars in federal funds on education programs like Head Start for pre-K children, free- or reduced-priced school lunches for low-income children and teacher training programs.

Help us make sure #PSJACounts by responding today!

https://www.2020census.gov/

---
¿Sabía usted? Los resultados del Censo 2020 son utilizados por funcionarios federales, estatales y locales para informar las decisiones sobre cómo gastar miles de millones de dólares en fondos federales en programas educativos como Head Start para niños de prekínder, almuerzos escolares gratuitos o de precio reducido para comidas de bajo costo.

¡Responda hoy!

https://www.2020census.gov/

post_text:
For the second consecutive year, Pharr-San Juan-Alamo ISD was named the winner of the Large School District Category of the statewide It’s Time Texas Community Challenge sponsored by H-E-B.

“We are so proud of our PSJA Family for taking on this statewide competition,” said PSJA Superintendent Dr. Jorge L. Arredondo. “Winning in the large school district category shows our commitment to the health and wellness of our students and staff. Now more than ever, we will continue to place the physical, emotional and mental health of our students, families and staff in the forefront. Together we can make a difference, and become a stronger PSJA.”

#ItsTimeTexas #HealthierTexas

PSJAISD.US

post_text:
Great news!

The deadline for the one-time Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) has been extended to August 21, 2020.

All PSJA students are eligible, apply today!

https://yourtexasbenefits.com/Learn/PEBT
-----
¡Buenas noticias!

El programa Transferencia Electrónica de Beneficios durante la Pandemia (P-EBT) dará a las familias que cumplan los requisitos un pago único por cada hijo que haya recibido previamente comidas gratuitas o a bajo costo.

Los beneficios del programa P-EBT se podrán solicitar hasta el 21 de agosto de 2020 y todos los estudiantes de PSJA son elegibles.

Superintendent Dr. Jorge L. Arredondo, following proper protocols and safety measures, visited several PSJA facilities today along side PSJA Operations Division Chief Nick Martinez and PSJA Police Department Chief Rolando Garcia to check the state of the district following this weekend’s storms.

A complete assessment of the District's structural and mechanical operations is ongoing, and every facility has been physically evaluated. Thank you to all the team members who helped assess our facilities after the storm. Stay safe #PSJAFamily!

post_text:
The PSJA Emergency Response Team is making preparations for the upcoming possible tropical storm to our area.

As of 5:00 pm today, Friday, July 24, 2020, they have been working with the Red Cross and Texas Guard to use PSJA schools as a Base and Shelters, if needed.

PSJA school buses are on standby to move residents to the shelters. We ask all residents to stay up to date with new developments by periodically checking news outlets and our PSJA social media sites.

If you need any assistance you can call our PSJA Police Department at (956) 354-2175.

Stay safe PSJA Family! #PSJACares

post_text:
PSJA ISD is among three public school districts selected to partner with the University of Houston for a study to better understand the academic vocabulary assessment of secondary English language learners.

The research is part for a five-year $10 million grant from the Institute of Education Sciences to create and direct a national research and development center at the University of Houston for English Learners. The Center will be part of the UH Texas Institute for Measurement, Evaluation, and Statistics (TIMES).

“We are grateful to be part of this innovative research that will have a significant impact on English Language Learners as more than 40% of our students are considered Limited English Proficient (LEP) with Spanish being the primary language spoken at home,” said PSJA Superintendent Jorge L. Arredondo. “We want to continue to provide models and best evidence-based practices for the success of our English Language Learners students that will bring the highest level of academic and economic success.”

#PSJAProud

post_text:
Being a part of our PSJA Family means being part of a 100-year-legacy of traditions, life-changing opportunities, and an incredible network of successful alumni changing the world!

Wilberth Gonzalez, PSJA North Early College High School Alum and Associate Costume Designer for seven-time Tony Award Winning Costume Designer Catherine Zuber, is living his childhood dream of working in the Big Apple!

Gonzalez has assisted in designing pieces for numerous Broadway shows like “Moulin Rouge,” “My Fair Lady,” “The King and I,” “War Paint,” and most recently “Mrs. Doubtfire!”

Don't miss a chance to be part of our PSJA Family, registration for the 2020-2021 school year remains open.

Whether your family chooses to join us physically or virtually for the 2020-2021 school year, our mission of educating our students continues as we transition to this new frontier in public education with the health and safety of our students, teachers and staff as our top priority.

Register today www.psjaisd.us/register

#PSJAAlumni #PSJAFamily

post_text:
As a way to continue providing coordinated support for students and families following the effects of COVID-19, the PSJA ISD School Board passed a policy recently that will offer students and families Social and Emotional Learning (SEL) with wraparound services.

“This pandemic has created stress in households worldwide, and we want to be able to help serve our PSJA Family in every way we can," said PSJA Superintendent Dr. Jorge Arredondo. “As we return to school this fall, this policy will help us ensure that our efforts are balanced between academic and non-academic needs to address the social and emotional stability of our students.”

Read more here: https://bit.ly/3evmzH6
text:
As a way to continue providing coordinated support for students and families following the effects of COVID-19, the PSJA ISD School Board passed a policy recently that will offer students and families Social and Emotional Learning (SEL) with wraparound services.

“This pandemic has created stress in households worldwide, and we want to be able to help serve our PSJA Family in every way we can," said PSJA Superintendent Dr. Jorge Arredondo. “As we return to school this fall, this policy will help us ensure that our efforts are balanced between academic and non-academic needs to address the social and emotional stability of our students.”

For PSJA alumna and author Amanda Puryer-El, encouraging students to believe in themselves through her books is her motivation.

Amanda graduated from PSJA North High School in 2001 and earned an Associate Degree in Communication from the University of Texas-Pan American in 2005.

"I want these kids to every day be like 'I am beautiful. I am going to shine like a star all day' because how you go out in the world is how you will be that day."

We are proud to provide life-changing opportunities for ALL students.

Don't miss a chance to be part of our PSJA Family, registration for the 2020-2021 school year remains open. Register today www.psjaisd.us/register

#PSJAFamily

For PSJA Parent Hilario Gomez seeing his children fluorish at PSJA is one of his greatest joys.

"PSJA sees past my son's disabilities and see his abilities. He's grown in math, reading, writing..getting him ready for a college or a university."

Did you know? PSJA ISD is an open enrollment school district and accepts students living anywhere in the Valley. To learn more about opportunities available or register, visit www.psjaisd.us/register

Parents, if you've already registered, remember to select the learning option that best first your needs for the 2020-2021 school year by August 1 at www.psjaisd.us/options

post_text:
For PSJA Parent Cindie Rivera-Hernandez witnessing her daughter graduate with an Associate Degree from South Texas College an entire semester before her high school graduation this May meant the world!

"PSJA has allowed my daughter, and not limited her. She is a cheerleader, in a State winning Mariachi...she is in Orchestra and has gone to State twice. She is an Ambassador for PSJA and she has already graduated with her Associate," shared Rivera-Hernandez who is a proud PSJA alumna and English teacher at PSJA Early College High School. "Seeing her accomplish that at such a young age tells me that she can do anything she wants."

To learn about our nationally recognized Early College Program, visit www.psjaisd.us/earlycollege

Parents, if you've already registered, remember to select the learning option that best first your needs for the 2020-2021 school year by August 1 at www.psjaisd.us/options

"PSJA is home to me. It's woven into my life. I love giving back to the community that I grew up in," said PSJA Alumna Cynthia Quezada.

Quezada graduated from PSJA High School in 2011 with an Associate Degree in Engineering from South Texas College. She earned a Bachelor of Science in Architecture from UTSA in 2014.

Don't miss a chance to be part of our PSJA Family, registration for the 2020-2021 school year remains open www.psjaisd.us/register

post_text:
Out of an abundance of caution due to the recent increase of COVID-19 cases in our county, Meals-On-The-Go will be suspended until further notice. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation as we look out for the health of our families and staff during this pandemic.

Please ensure you do your part by staying at home, wearing a mask when in public, and washing your hands with soap and water for 20 seconds. Together we can slow the spread.

——

Por precaución debido al incremento de casos de COVID-19 en nuestro condado, la distribución de comidas será suspendida hasta nuevo aviso. Apreciamos su comprensión y cooperación mientras vemos por la salud de nuestras familias y empleados durante esta pandemia.

Por favor cerciore de hacer su parte al quedarse en casa, utilizando una mascarilla cuando salga y lavándose las manos con agua y jabón por 20 segundos. Juntos podemos disminuir el número de casos.

With exciting challenges, present-day themes and fun prizes, our PSJA librarians are inviting all students to join their summer-long reading adventure challenge!

Students are able to take part in virtual book clubs, find Manga, Anime and graphic novels, participate in art contests, learn about “Woke” reading and so much more!

Those wanting to participate in the challenge can visit www.psjaisd.us/SummerReads for more information, as well as the PSJA Library Services page for updates and details about all the challenges.

Learn more here: https://bit.ly/3gpBT9u

post_text:
A group of PSJA Southwest Early College High School architecture students recently presented their ideas for a safe return to school this fall to a group of district leaders.

Among the topics the students discussed were: abiding by TEA and CDC guidelines, handling large crowds, classrooms, restrooms, organizing a safe lunch schedule, distance learning and they even used a 3D home design software called Homestyler to create a virtual reality simulation of what their ideas could look like at their campus.

Check out some of the highlights of the meeting!

post_text:
Did you know? At PSJA ISD students get to learn about sustainability and environmental awareness through their curriculum and extracurricular organizations. Many get to learn about nature and the environment through outdoor classrooms that feature native habitat gardens. We hope the "Grow With Us" Initiative helps these efforts continue from home despite the COVID-19 pandemic.

For Derek Mercado, a 4th-grade student at Carmen Anaya Elementary, the food shortages because of the COVID-19 pandemic made him and his family realize the importance of sustainability.

“I have always wanted to grow my own garden," said Mercado. "I want to help the environment, so bees don’t go extinct, protect our trees, and because of the Coronavirus, I want to stay home and eat my own vegetables. Thank you to PSJA for inspiring me to do this.”

#PSJACares PSJA Operations Division PSJA Sustainability

PSJAISD.US

post_text:
Congratulations to Adrian Gonzalez, PSJA North Early College High School Class of 2016 alum, for graduating from St. Edward's University with a Bachelor of Arts in Writing & Rhetoric with a concentration in Journalism & Digital Media and a Minor in Communication.

Gonzalez is a graduate of our PSJA Early College Program and earned an Associate Degree in Interdisciplinary Studies from STC before receiving his high school diploma in 2016.

While at St. Edward's, Adrian made the Dean's list four times and was inducted into the Alpha Lambda Delta Honor Society. He was also involved with the campus' student-led newspaper where he served as Sports Editor for 2 years. Adrian interned with the PSJA ISD Communication Dept. and also with the City of Austin's Office of Sustainability.

Way to go Adrian!

#PSJAProud #PSJACollegeGrads

post_text:
Congratulations to PSJA Family Member Loretta Sanchez for her recent promotion as PSJA ISD’s Licensed Professional Counselor for the 2020-2021 School Year!

Mrs. Sanchez has been a School Counselor in PSJA for over 10 years and an LPC for 3 years. She is also a Registered Play Therapist and trained EMDR and Sandplay therapies. She is currently a third-year Counselor Education and Supervision Doctoral student at the University of the Cumberlands and has a Master’s in Educational Psychology from UTRGV. She is excited to continue her professional career serving the students and families of PSJA.

“I look forward to utilizing my expertise in helping students and families overcome a variety of challenges and remove the stigmas from mental health and wellness.”

Congratulations Mrs. Sanchez!

Congratulations to PSJA Family Member Lilian I. Villarreal for her recent promotion as Augusto Guerra Elementary's Principal for the 2020-2021 School Year!

Ms. Villarreal has been with the district for 12 years. She was an ELA Teacher at PSJA ECHS, Collaborative Learning Leader, and Assistant Principal at both Ford Elementary and Liberty Middle School. She received her Master's in Educational Leadership and Principal Certification from UTPA, and she plans to pursue a Doctorate in Educational Administration in the near future.

Congratulations!

#PSJAProud

text:
Congratulations to PSJA Family Member Alma De La Rosa for her recent promotion as PSJA Southwest Early College High School Assistant Principal for the 2020-2021 School Year!

Mrs. De La Rosa has been with the district for 8 years and has 9 in education. She was the Collaborative Learning Leader at PSJA Elvis J. Ballew/CCTA prior to this selection. She received her Bachelor’s Degree in Biology from UTPA and her Master’s Degree in Bilingual Education and Principal Certification from UTRGV.

Congratulations!

#PSJAFamily

post_text:
We will continue to work toward providing our families with the back to school options that best fit their needs and desires.

Our team is currently working diligently to have options available that continue to promote the health and safety of students, teachers and staff. Whether a family chooses to join us physically or virtually, our mission of educating our students continues as we transition to this new frontier in public education.

------------------

El Distrito Escolar de Pharr-San Juan-Álamo continúa trabajando para proporcionarle a sus familias las opciones de regreso a clases que más se acercen a sus necesidades y deseos.

Nuestro equipo actualmente está trabajando duro en crear estas opciones que ayudarán a promover la salud y el bienestar de nuestros estudiantes, maestros y empleados. Ya sea que nuestras familias decidan acompañarnos física o virtualmente, seguirémos nuestra misión de educar a nuestros estudiantes mientras entramos a esta nueva dínamica en educación pública.

post_text:
Congratulations to PSJA Early College High School Alumna Yesenia Bustos for graduating with a Masters in Public Administration from East Carolina University!

Yesenia participated in St. Edwards University College Assistance Migrant Program (CAMP) and graduated with a Aachelors Degree in Global Studies. In 2014, Yesenia participated in SAF’s Into the Fields Internship at North Carolina and has then been committed to the farmworker movement.

She has served as a paralegal with the farmworkers union to Lead Coordinator at NC Fields and eventually second director. She is currently serving on the Board of Directors Student Action Farmworkers. To celebrate her recent graduation, she is fundraising to support the next generation and ensure college students continue to receive training, mentorship, and financial support to become social justice advocates.

Way to go Yesenia!

#PSJAProud #PSJAAlumni

post_text:
Congratulations again to our 2020 PSJA Student Profiles representing each of our comprehensive high schools and named recipients of the first-ever Superintendent Scholarship.

First launched in 2014, the PSJA Student Profiles is a district-level award program that recognizes seniors who demonstrate excellence in academics, athletics, fine arts and community service. To be selected, students had to be nominated by faculty or staff and go through a blind selection process where district judges selected the top nominations.

“Congratulations to each of these students for representing our district and their high schools so highly,” said PSJA Superintendent Dr. Jorge L. Arredondo who surprised the students with a $750 scholarship during a recent Zoom meeting. “Thank you to the staff who nominated them and our district judges for making the tough decision of selecting the top candidates. It is my honor to present them with this scholarship as a small token of appreciation for being stellar students and proud members of our PSJA Family.”

#PSJAProud
shared_text:
PSJAISD.US
PSJA ISD announces 2020 Student Profiles, awards first Superintendent Scholarships

First launched in 2014, the PSJA Student Profiles is a district-level award program that recognizes seniors who demonstrate excellence in academics, athletics, fine arts and community service. To be selected, students had to be nominated by faculty or staff and go through a blind selection process where district judges selected the top nominations.

“Congratulations to each of these students for representing our district and their high schools so highly,” said PSJA Superintendent Dr. Jorge L. Arredondo who surprised the students with a $750 scholarship during a recent Zoom meeting. “Thank you to the staff who nominated them and our district judges for making the tough decision of selecting the top candidates. post_text:
Estimados padres,

Su hogar puede ser elegible para recibir los beneficios de la Transferencia Electrónica de Beneficios por Pandemia para comprar alimentos. La P-EBT es para niños de 5 a 18 años que recibieron beneficios de alimentos del SNAP para el mes de marzo de 2020 y para niños de hasta 21 años que estén certificados para recibir comidas gratuitas o a precio reducido en la escuela en Texas durante el año escolar 2019-20.

La P-EBT es un beneficio único para familias emitido a través de una tarjeta de EBT, como una tarjeta de débito. Las familias pueden recibir hasta $285 por cada niño. A partir de la fecha en que se emitieron los beneficios, tendrá un año para usar sus beneficios de la P-EBT.

Si necesita ayuda para completar la P-EBT, llame al 833-613-6220.

Hey PSJA Family,

Hidalgo County is hosting a 13-week Fright Night Lights Census Competition where school districts compete against each other week to increase completion of the 2020 Census!

We are on Week 3 and taking on McAllen ISD! Help us stay in the lead by responding to your Census survey today www.2020census.gov

Congratulations to our PSJA Family for finishing in the lead after taking on Edinburg CISD last week!

Let's show the RGV and nation that #PSJACounts!

post_text:
Two PSJA ISD Alumni and Early College Graduates recently fulfilled their dreams of graduating from law school. Brianna Garza and Luis Guerrero were among the youngest lawyers to graduate in their class at ages 23 and 24, respectively.

According to Guerrero and Garza, college was challenging, but they were grateful for the preparation they received at PSJA ISD and endless support they got from the College Transition Program throughout their undergraduate journey.

“It truly takes a village to help us students succeed,” said Guerrero. “The PSJA Early College Program gives you so many opportunities. At the age of 18 I was able to tell my parents that they didn’t have to worry about paying for my college education. Thank you to my PSJA Family for their support and guidance.”

#PSJAProud #PSJACollegeComplete #PSJAAlumni

post_text:
Congratulations to PSJA T. Jefferson T-Stem ECHS Alumna Jessica Zamarripa for graduating from Texas A&M University with a BS in Electrical Engineering.

Jessica is a graduate of our PSJA Early College Program in partnership with South Texas College and earned an Associate Degree in Mathematics before receiving her high school diploma in 2016.

During her time at Texas A&M University, she participated as an undergraduate research assistant where she published her research work entitled ‘Towards High-Frequency Shape Memory Alloy Actuators Incorporating Liquid Metal Energy Circuits’. In 2018 she was awarded the Ephrahim Garcia Best Paper Award at the ASNE SMART Material Conference. She graduated as an NAE Engineering Grand Challenges Scholar and Greater Texas Foundation Aggie Scholar.

This fall, she plans to pursue graduate school to obtain a Masters of Science in Material Science and Engineering at Texas A&M University.

Know a PSJA alum who has graduated or will be graduating soon? Let us know? www.psjaisd.us/collegegrads

#PSJAClassof2020 #PSJAProud

shared_text:
Royal Garden By Lulu Jaramillo
May 21 at 1:36 PM ·

We were supposed to have their graduation here with us at the elegant Royal Garden By Lulu Jaramillo but due to this pandemic it had to be canceled. But WE had to do something for them so they can feel the LOVE during this time! 💕🥰🐻
PSJA Pathways Toward Independence/LIFE Program is such an amazing program that we have the privilege of being part of. This kids have made such a great impact in our business & in our hearts! 💕. We’re truly blessed & happy to have been part of their journey to independence! We wish you each & one of you the VERY best! CONGRATULATIONS CLASS OF 2020!!!! 👩🏻‍🎓 👨🏻‍🎓 🎓 WE WILL MISS YOU!! 💕💕
& for all the other students we miss you & we cannot wait to have you back!!!! 💕💕💕💕
#ptistudents #psjaproud #royalgardenpharr #royalgardenlulujaramillo #galeriabyregency #galeriabylulujaramillo #elegance #lulujaramillo

post_text:
Congratulations to Kasandra Garza, PSJA Memorial Early College High School Class of 2017 Alumna, for graduating with a Bachelor's in International Relations from the University of Texas at Austin!

Garza had the opportunity to represent the RGV and UTA in CapeTown, South Africa where she was accepted by Ubizo Tours for an internship in the Summer of 2018. She completed a Capstone upon completion of her bachelors degree where she received an A for her work.

Way to go!

If you know any other PSJA Alumni who have graduated or will be graduating soon, please share their achievement with us by going to www.psjaisd.us/alumni

#PSJAAlumni #PSJAProud #PowerofPublic

post_text:
Breaking a district record, 541 PSJA ISD seniors were named candidates to receive Associate Degrees from South Texas College during the 2019-2020 school year in numerous fields including Biology, Criminal Justice, and Mathematics, to name a few!

Out of the 541 Early College graduates, 96 of them graduated from STC in December 2019, an entire semester before receiving their high school diploma. Eighty students received industry certifications in fields like Welding and Automotive.

Congratulations to our amazing PSJA Early College Graduates! 🎓

Read the full story: https://bit.ly/3cTJSKz

To learn more about our nationally-recognized Early College Program visit www.psjaisd.us/earlycollege

#PSJAProud #onlyatPSJA

post_text:
Congratulations to Brianna Garza, PSJA North Early College High School class of 2014 alumna, for graduating as a Juris Doctor from Thurgood Marshall School of Law!

Garza was part of the first cohort graduating from PSJA ISD's Early College Program in partnership with South Texas College and earned an Associate Degree in Interdisciplinary Studies two weeks before her high school graduation in 2014.

She graduated from the University of Texas Rio Grande Valley with a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science and minors in Legal Studies and English in December 2016 and got accepted into the Thurgood Marshall School of Law at age 20.

Way to go Brianna!

Know any other PSJA Alumni graduating soon? Share their achievement with us by going to www.psjaisd.us/collegegrads

#PSJAAlumni #PSJAProud

post_text:
Good morning PSJA Family,

We are excited to invite our incoming 6th-grade students to enroll in our first Virtual Summer Spanish Preparatory Course! We will have three sessions available from May 26-June 18. This course will help your child prepare for the Spanish language curriculum students take in middle school. Don't miss this great opportunity for them to brush up on their Spanish skills or learn concepts they need to be successful.

You may register for this course online at www.psjaisd.us/summerspanish.

_____________

Buenos días Familia de PSJA,

Estamos contentos de poder invitar a nuestros estudiantes que pronto entrarán al sexto grado a que se inscriban al curso de preparación en español este verano. El curso será virtual y tiene disponible tres sesiones del 26 de mayo al 18 de junio. En este curso, su hijo o hija podrán prepararse para el plan de estudios en español que tomarán empezando la secundaria. No pierdan esta gran oportunidad.

Pueden registrar a sus hijos visitando la siguiente página:
www.psjaisd.us/summerspanish.

Congratulations to Luis Guerrero, PSJA Southwest Early College High School class of 2014 alum, for graduating as a Juris Doctor from St. Mary's University School of Law!

Guerrero was part of the first cohort of students to graduate from our Early College Program in partnership with South Texas College and earned Associate Degrees in Mathematics and Science two weeks before his high school graduation in 2014. Just three years later, he graduated from Texas A&M University with a Bachelor of Science in Petroleum Geology.

Way to go Luis!

There is still time to submit entries for our PSJA ISD Time Capsule Letter Contest!

Prompt
Write a letter to the future leaders/students of PSJA. Describe what you love most about the world today, and what you hope to see in the next 25 years. In your letter, share what would you tell future students about your school experience today? What will the world be like in 25 years? How do you imagine PSJA ISD to be in the future?

Open to all PSJA ISD students.

Deadline Friday, May 22, 2020

www.psjaisd.us/letter

post_text:
Hello PSJA Family,

We hope you are doing well! As you know, before this pandemic happened we had reached out to you multiple times to gather feedback to build our new district's Vision and Mission Statement. We are excited to share with you the most recent draft.

Please share your thoughts with us! Let us know of any elements you like or you wish it had to help us reach our goals for the next several years. We appreciate your feedback!

Share your thoughts via the following link: https://my.thoughtexchange.com/scroll/222089649 - it will be open until Wednesday, May 20, 2020. Thank you!

post_text:
On this very special episode of our PSJA Family Podcast, our Superintendent took the time to hear from our High School Student Council Leaders about what it means to them to soon finish their high school journey. The students also got to share heartfelt messages to their fellow classmates and PSJA Family.

"On behalf of the student body, we'd like to thank the PSJA Family, faculty, staff, and everyone that has been super supportive to us during all this by sending us kind messages. It really does make a difference," shared @PSJA North Early College High School STUCO President Victoria Brewster. "To the Class of 2020, we may be different than all the other classes but we are all going to accomplish amazing things. I can't wait to see what we will accomplish in the future."

Listen to this and more episodes of our PSJA Family Podcast anytime, anywhere here www.psjaisd.us/podcast

#PSJATogetherApart #PSJAFamilyPodcast

post_text:
Don't forget! Tonight at 7 p.m. Central Time, former President Barack Obama will be delivering a commencement address to graduating seniors nationwide as part of an hour-long multimedia Graduate Together: America Honors the High School Class of 2020 event.

This program will be aired simultaneously Saturday evening by more than 20 broadcast TV and digital streaming partners. Joining Obama will be NBA star and school founder LeBron James, Nobel Prize winner Malala Yousafzai, the Jonas Brothers and soccer superstar Megan Rapinoe, among others.

The event will feature highlights from thousands of student submissions, a collection of commencement addresses, celebrity performances and inspirational vignettes. Learn more about this event.

This one-hour primetime special airs on ABC, CBS, FOX, and NBC, and will be streaming on multiple online platforms.

For more, visit https://graduatetogether2020.com/

post_text:
Did you know? Thousands of students and their families in PSJA ISD learned about the 2020 Census through interactive Google Classroom lessons as part of PSJA Census Week held May 27-May 1, 2020.

PSJA Census Week was held in partnership with district partners City of Pharr, San Juan, and Alamo and consisted of various distance learning Social Studies lessons and interactive activities like photos and TikTok Challenges.

In addition to promoting the Census 2020 at the classroom level, PSJA ISD district leaders in the PSJA Census Committee are also promoting the mandated survey to employees via department outreach and to the community through efforts by Parent Census Ambassadors through the PSJA Parental Engagement Program.

Respond to the Census today! www.2020census.gov

#PSJACounts @CityofAlamo @CityofSanJuan

post_text:
As a special way to wrap up Teacher Appreciation Week, our PSJA Superintendent Dr. Arredondo took the time to hear from Daniel Ramirez Elementary Teacher Lezlie Neeley!

With over 35 years of experience, Mrs. Neeley shared how the pandemic has challenged her and her colleagues to step up and continue educating the future.

"Having educated students for over a hundred years, at PSJA ISD we strive to be the best. We are on the map and very well-known throughout the nation and I think that is because PSJA has created this family," shared Neeley. "We are all going to grow from this experience, the administration, the teachers, the students, and parents. We are going to be better prepared for whatever comes our way."

Listen to this podcast episode anytime, anywhere on Spotify! www.psjaisd.us/podcast

#PSJATogetherApart #TeachersCan Raise Your Hand Texas

post_text:
Our PSJA ISD Board approved to host the first school district COVID-19 Testing Site in Hidalgo County!

PSJA Health Services together with local and private medical practitioners consider the coronavirus outbreak a call to action.

"We pledge to do whatever we can to help prevent the spread of this terrible disease and will be offering coronavirus testing in conjunction with Preventive Health Solutions and Dr. Ricardo Ochoa," said Sulema Solis, PSJA Director of Health Services.

Anyone in the area who wishes to be tested for COVID-19 may do so, based on test availability starting Tuesday, May 5, 2020 until Friday, May 8, 2020 from 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm at PSJA North Early College High School. The test will be administered to anyone regardless of symptoms or other risk factors in a drive-thru form.

Read the full story: https://bit.ly/35B4Qez

#PSJACares

May is National Foster Care Month! 👦👧

It's a time to recognize that we each can play a part in enhancing the lives of children and youth in foster care. Find resources and information to help ensure that their future is bright on the #FosterCareMonth website. https://www.childwelfare.gov/fostercaremonth/

Thank you to the numerous Foster Families within our tri-city area for taking care of our youth and their future! 🎓 #NFCM2020

Today is School Lunch Hero Day! Thank you to our PSJA Child Nutrition Department for continuing to faithfully serve our students during these times.

Did you know? More than 65,000 breakfast and lunch meals were safely distributed to children in March & April, and more than 70 cases of food items were donated to the RGV Food Bank as part of our efforts to continue serving our community during these challenging times.

post_text:
So proud of our high schools for being ranked among the top in Texas & Nation, according to the 2020 US News & World Report, with PSJA T. Jefferson T-Stem ECHS ranked among the top 100!

The U.S. News & World Report ranks schools based on their performance in state-required tests and how well students are prepared for college. U.S. News ranked approximately 17,790 public high schools, out of a review of more than 24,000 in all 50 states and the District of Columbia.

Congratulations to the students, parents, and amazing staff for their tremendous work! It takes a team!

Read the full story: https://bit.ly/3aKf2T3

#PSJAProud #PSJACollegeReady

post_text:
Happy Arbor Day! 🌳

Did you know?Trees can help clean our air, provide oxygen, cool the earth, reduce home energy costs, and reduce the effects of climate change 🏭

Post a picture of your favorite tree with #arbordayathome, and tag @ArborDay. The Foundation will plant a tree on your behalf…up to 50,000 trees total!

For kids, check out https://bit.ly/3cGm7oN for fun tree-centered games and activities, or find out how YOU can plant a tree at https://bit.ly/2zlpCCJ!

post_text:
Congratulations to 4 PSJA seniors who have been awarded the highly competitive Gates Scholarship!

Selected from a pool of over 36,500 applicants from across the country, the seniors will receive funds to pay their entire university career and post-graduate education.

All four are participating in our PSJA ISD Early College Program in partnership with South Texas College and have already earned or will be graduating with Associate Degrees May 2020.

Full story: https://bit.ly/2XYRk2u

#PSJAProud #PSJATogetherApart PSJA College Readiness Department

post_text:
Congratulations to PSJA Early College High School Football Player Jayden Arrington for signing a letter of intent to play football for Texas Lutheran University!

Jayden was 30-6A All-District selection and was selected to play in the 2019 Blue-Grey All American game at AT&T Stadium in Arlington this past season.

Jayden received an Associates's Degree in Interdisciplinary Studies from South Texas College and will finish high school with up 2 years of nursing school through our PSJA Project-HEAL Program!

#PSJAProud

post_text:
We have been honored with the 2020 Best Communities for Music Education national designation from the NAMM Foundation for our outstanding commitment to music education!

"Earning this designation for the 6th year in-a-row is not an easy feat. We are so proud of our students and staff for their hard work and dedication,” said PSJA Superintendent of Schools Dr. Jorge L. Arredondo. “At PSJA ISD we take pride in providing quality fine arts opportunities for our Pre-K through 12th-grade students. Thank you to our board of trustees and administration for their continued support.”

Read the full story: https://bit.ly/2RDxDtk

#PSJAProud #PSJAFineArts

Our students and their families will now have access to on-demand counseling services thanks to a partnership with Alliance Child & Family Solutions (ACFS).

The PSJA Telehealth Program provides on-demand virtual counseling to students and families by licensed mental health professionals.

These behavioral counseling services are a component of our PSJA Telemedicine Program offered in partnership with Urgent Care for Kids and Preventive Health Solutions.

To learn more, visit https://bit.ly/2Xgo8E2

#PSJACares #PSJAStrong

Good morning PSJA Family,

We have received confirmation that one of our PSJA students is part of the list of COVID-19 cases in Hidalgo County. As this pandemic continues it is important to continue following the recommendations from health officials by practicing social distancing.

Campuses and buildings will continue to be closed and will only be opened on a case-by-case basis for administrators in our effort to keep safety and well being a top priority.

Please keep this student and family in your thoughts and prayers.

#PSJATogetherApart

post_text:
Happy Cesar Chavez Day! Today we recognize him for being one of the greatest leaders in the 20th century.

Cesar Chavez was an activist who fought for equality for Latinos and toward bettering the conditions of farm workers.

He is best known for his influence in the Mexican American community and for advocating for social justice but who has also influenced all races, nationalities, ages, and genders to stand tall as well as fight against injustice and discrimination.

#CesarChavezDay

post_text:
We were honored to recently host the 5th Annual Mesa Comunitaria in partnership with ARISE and the Intercultural Development Research Association (IDRA) out of San Antonio.

During this unique conference, students get to lead the sessions aimed to help parents parents learn more about programs the district has to offer such as the Dual Language Enrichment Program and Early College Initiative.

"Being a part of this program helps me feel like I am part of a family and helps preserve who we are, our culture," said PSJA Memorial Early College High School student Alicia Vargas who is part of the PSJA Early College Program and Dual Language Program.

#PSJAProud

post_text:
We are excited to announce our PSJA Time Capsule Letter Contest for all PSJA ISD students!

As part of the contest, we welcome students to submit letters to the future leaders of PSJA for the opportunity to be included in the PSJA Centennial Time Capsule to be buried during a historic ceremony on May 13, 2020 at PSJA T. Jefferson T-STEM ECHS.

The contest is open to all students. The top elementary, middle school, and high school student will be invited to attend the PSJA Time Capsule Ceremony to be held Wednesday, May 13, 2020 at PSJA T. Jefferson T-Stem ECHS at 10:00 am.

Essay Prompt
Write a letter to the future leaders/students of PSJA. Describe what you love most about the world today, and what you hope to see in the next 25 years. In your letter, share what would you tell future students about your school experience today? What will the world be like in 25 years? How do you imagine PSJA ISD to be in the future?

Contest Deadline
Tuesday April 17, 2020
PSJA Communications Dept.

#PSJA100

Happy International Women’s Day!

Today we celebrate women for their contributions to their workplace, communities, and society. Women who have exemplified strength, commitment and leadership.

Remembering and honoring the women trailblazers who have shaken societal norms and have given younger women and girls leverage to soar in a non-gender bias world.

Who are those women to you? Tag a woman who's inspired or impacted you.

#IWD2020 #EachforEqual

Our PSJA Law and Public Service Career Pathway provides students with the opportunity to get certified as a 911 Dispatcher or Level II Non-Commissioned Security Officer!

Offered through the PSJA Career & Technical Education, these certifications help students get a jumpstart on future law enforcement jobs in police departments, the FBI, DEA, Border Patrol & US Customs to name a few.

Students interested can contact their high school counselor to enroll.

#CTEMonth #PSJAProud

shared_text:
PSJA Early College High School
March 3 at 5:22 PM ·

Don Ramón Ayala, el Rey del Acordeón, visitó nuestra preparatoria para apoyar Los Osos Poderosos de PSJA y desearles mucho éxito en su carrera musical. El Señor Ayala, líder de la agrupación Los Bravos del Norte, inició su carrera en 1964 y en donde ha grabado un total de 116 discos.

Camarógrafos: Raul Bautista y Artemio Hernández.
text:
PSJA Early College High School
March 3 at 5:22 PM ·

Don Ramón Ayala, el Rey del Acordeón, visitó nuestra preparatoria para apoyar Los Osos Poderosos de PSJA y desearles mucho éxito en su carrera musical. El Señor Ayala, líder de la agrupación Los Bravos del Norte, inició su carrera en 1964 y en donde ha grabado un total de 116 discos.

Camarógrafos: Raul Bautista y Artemio Hernández.

March 3 at 5:53 PM ·

Over 2,200 5th grade students at PSJA ISD are getting exposed to the different career pathways available at PSJA during the 2020 Career Fair happening this week!

In addition to learning about the different academic programs available at PSJA through the Career & Technical Education Program and College Readiness Program, students got to visit with other local businesses.

Some of the entities in attendance included: The Tooth Place RGV, Melyssa Anne Photography, IBC Bank, the Texas Department of Public Safety, several colleges.

#PSJAProud #PublicSchoolsWeek #loveyourISD

shared_text:
PSJA ISD added 30 new photos.
March 2 at 5:06 PM ·

Five PSJA ISD students were honored at the very first Capstone Scholars RGV fundraising event held Feb. 28, 2020.

Capstone Scholars RGV is a first-of-its-kind nonprofit organization founded by Maribel Alvarez, who heard about the senior Capstone projects at PSJA T. Jefferson T-STEM ECHS, and wanted to honor hard-working seniors and gather the community to contribute towards their higher education.

The seniors were selected by the campus' Senior Capstone Teacher Yvonne Chamblin and PSJA Director of Advanced Academics Michael Murray.

Congratulations!

post_text:
Happy National School Breakfast Week!

According to the School Nutrition Association (SNA), studies show that children who eat school breakfast are more likely to:
• Reach higher levels of achievement in reading and math
• Score higher on standardized tests
• Have better concentration and memory
• Be more alert and maintain a healthy weight

The PSJA School Breakfast Program serves more than 14 million children every school day!

What is your favorite school breakfast?

post_text:
Happy National Athletic Trainers’ Month (NATM)!

Sponsored by the National Athletic Trainers’ Association (NATA), March is the month where Athletic Trainers are celebrated for their work and to spread awareness about the importance of their care.

This year’s theme is “ATs Impact Health Care Through Action.”
Athletic Trainers (ATs) make an impact through every action taken to care for and rehabilitate Athletes.

Thank You Athletic Trainers for every action taken to provide compassionate care!

Share the actions of your athletic trainer and how it has impacted you.
#NATM2020

post_text:
March is National Nutrition Month!

The PSJA Child Nutrition Department prepares food for all 32,000+ students at our schools daily.

Students can get free breakfast, lunch, and even a supper meal (for students who participate in after school activities).

Students with medical needs or food allergies are also accommodated with special diets. Contact the PSJA Child Nutrition Department at (956) 784-8545 to learn more!

#nationalnutritionmonth

shared_text:
WWW.PSJAISD.US
Modelo dual de PSJA

PSJA Dual Language Program
February 28 at 5:02 PM ·

¿Sabías qué PSJA es el único distrito escolar en el sur de Texas que gradúa estudiantes con el sello de doble alfabetización?

En la primaria, los estudiantes aprenden a leer en su primer idioma. Al inicio de 2o grado, los estudiantes reciben dos cursos de artes de lenguaje. Uno en inglés y el otro en español. Así es como los estudiantes aprenden a leer en dos idiomas. Empezando en PK3-5o grado, ciencias y estudios sociales se enseñan en español y matemáticas se enseña en ingles.

En la secundaria los estudiantes continúan tomando clases en ambos idiomas. Los estudiantes toman arte de lenguaje en español y en inglés y tienen opción de tomar una variedad de cursos en matemáticas, ciencias, o estudios sociales en español.

En PSJA sobresalimos en proveer una excelente educación bilingüe que prepara a los estudiantes para un diverso ambiente laboral.

PSJAISD
#ValesPorDos
#PSJADualLanguage

We take pride in offering life-changing academic and career opportunities for all students!

Did you know? ALL PSJA ISD high school students can graduate with one or more of the following career endorsements:

* Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics (STEM)
* Business & Industry
* Public Service
* Arts & Humanities
* Multidisciplinary Studies

Endorsements are a sequence of related courses grouped together by interest and skills offered through the PSJA Career & Technical Education.

#CTEMonth #LifeChanging #PSJAProud

post_text:
Thank you KVEO for highlighting this story!

The grants from Lowe's Home Improvement were used to construct a solar powered classroom with lab, kitchen and hydroponic garden system including lifted garden beds accessible for all students the garden is open to the district and residents.

“In retrospect we wanted the kids to learn how to garden. How to grow healthy food, health and well-being and also giving them a good education," said PSJA Buell Central Social Studies teacher Stacey Proctor.

#onlyatPSJA

post_text:
Congratulations to Kelly-Pharr Elementary for being nominated as a 2020 National Blue Ribbon School!

Initiated by the U.S. Department of Education (USDE) in 1982, the National Blue Ribbon Schools program recognizes public and private elementary, middle, and high schools that have high student achievement and/or highlights where exemplary progress has been made in closing achievement gaps among student subpopulations.

The nominated schools must now complete a rigorous application process conducted by the USDE. National award winners will be announced in September 2020. Schools that receive the designation are recognized at the Blue Ribbon Schools Awards Ceremony in Washington, D.C.

#PSJAProud

The nominated schools must now complete a rigorous application process conducted by the USDE. National award winners will be announced in September 2020. Schools that receive the designation are recognized at the Blue Ribbon Schools Awards Ceremony in Washington, D.C.

post_text:
What was inspired by an interactive history lesson, has sprouted into a beautiful new community garden at PSJA Buell Green Inc. thanks to two generous grants totaling $24,500 from Lowe's Home Improvement.

According to Buell Central Social Studies Teacher Stacey Proctor, the project was inspired by a lesson on the "Homestead Act of 1862" that taught students about how the early settlers were able to keep over 160 acres of land if they raised livestock or cultivated. Through project-based learning, students were then inspired to find ways to cultivate their own food through a community garden.

“This PSJA Community Garden is open to the entire PSJA district and residents,” said Proctor during a grand opening celebration held Friday, Feb. 7, 2020. “We want students to learn to grow their own food and know where their food is coming from. Thank you to Lowe’s for their generous donation. They helped bring a dream to fruition.”

#PSJAProud
shared_text:
PSJAISD.US
Lowe’s donates $24,500 for sustainable community garden, outdoor classroom at PSJA ISD

Through project-based learning, students were then inspired to find ways to cultivate their own food through a community garden.

“This PSJA Community Garden is open to the entire PSJA district and residents,” said Proctor during a grand opening celebration held Friday, Feb. 7, 2020. “We want students to learn to grow their own food and know where their food is coming from. Thank you to Lowe’s for their generous donation. They helped bring a dream to fruition.”

post_text:
Our PSJA Family commends PSJA Memorial Early College High School Coach Clark and his students in the Wolverine Wrestling team for their heroic act of recently saving a 2-year-old’s life!

The team was eating at Chick-fil-A after a match when a mother rushed in asking for help because her daughter was choking. Without hesitation, Coach Clark and his team rushed to help.

Reflecting on their courageous act of saving a life, Coach Clark expressed gratitude for the rigorous mandatory First Aid training he’s received at PSJA ISD.

Thank you Coach and your students for what you did! 🙏

PSJA ISD added 22 new photos.
February 6 at 12:38 PM ·

Congratulations to PSJA North Early College High School's Seven Sanchez for signing a letter of intent to play college football with Texas A&M University-Kingsville!

Seven has had a tremendous tenure while at PSJA North. The Raider was named 2nd Team All-District his Sophomore year and the 30-6A Defensive MVP, 1st Team All-State, Whataburger Super Team his Junior year. That same year he led the nation in tackles per game-safeties.

His Senior year was no different earning the 30-6A Defensive MVP title, All-Area Defensive MVP, Whataburger Super Team and continuing to lead the nation in tackles per game.

Way to go, Seven!

While at PSJA Memorial Early College High School, Michael was a District Champ in Shot-Put and Discus and advanced to Area where he became Discus Champ and received Bronze in Shot-Put. He was also a Regional Champion in Discus and Qualified to State where he placed 7th.

During his time at PSJA Memorial he was also a 2nd Team All-District Quarterback and 1st Team All-District Punter as well as a 2nd Team All-District 1st Baseman in Baseball.

Congratulations Michael!

We were honored to host a special ribbon cutting ceremony for the new PSJA Agricultural Science Facility in partnership with the City of Pharr this morning.

The state-of-the art facility is possible thanks to a city-school partnership between the district and the City of Pharr and will enhance current academic programs available to provide richer learning experiences for future generations.

The facility features over 8,000 sq. ft. with 54 galvanized metal pens for large cattle and 81 for small animals.

post_text:
Happy National Women Physicians Day!

Did you know? This day marks the birthday of Dr. Elizabeth Blackwell, the first woman to receive a medical degree in the United States in 1849. Dr. Blackwell initiated the movement that helped women gain entry and equality in the field of medicine.

We celebrate all the woman physicians for all of your hard work and accomplishments! Thank you for providing health care for many of us! And for showing that it is possible for future women doctors to be in medicine.

#WomensDocsInspire #NWPD

post_text:
Today is National Freedom Day!

It is one of the founding principles of the United States. A day that commemorates February 1, 1865 –when Abraham Lincoln signed a joint resolution that proposed the 13th amendment to the United States Constitution. This important day ended slavery in this country. Today we celebrate our freedoms and liberties.

What freedoms are you most grateful for?

#FreedomDay #Peace #Love #Liberty

PSJA ISD added 19 new photos.
January 31 at 4:40 PM ·

Congratulations to PSJA Memorial Early College High School Senior Beyoncé Garza for signing a letter of intent this morning to join the Neosho Community College Track & Field Team. The College is located in Chanute, Kansas.

Garza is a 3-year letterman in Track & Field and has also been part of the Wolverine Cross Country team during her high school career.

While excelling in the classroom and on the track, she has also juggled a full-time job after school. These leadership characteristics have led her to receiving this opportunity to continue running Track at Neosho Community College.

#PSJAProud

shared_text:
PSJA ISD added 29 new photos.
January 31 at 6:10 PM ·

Today Texas A&M University School of Law Dean Robert B. Ahdieh spoke to students in our Pre-Law and Law Enforcement Institutes regarding the law school admission process.

In addition to hearing from Dean Robert B. Ahdieh, students got to participate in a hands-on field sobriety activity led by the PSJA Police Department demonstrating the importance of collaboration between the legal and law enforcement fields.

“Here at PSJA ISD we take pride in leading the way to provide life-changing opportunities for all of our students,” said PSJA Superintendent Dr. Jorge L. Arredondo. “Thank you to Dean Ahdieh and all the experts who took the time today to speak with our students.”

Wear your football jerseys and come join us with your families for food, games, moonjumps and more!

post_text:
Families earning less than $60,000 can get free income tax preparation assistance at 3 PSJA locations this tax season!

Sponsored by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), the VITA program offers free assistance to people with a household income of $60,000 or less, persons with disabilities, elderly and limited English speaking taxpayers. IRS-certified volunteers provide free basic income tax return preparation with electronic filing to individuals who qualify.

Several PSJA ISD high school students who are part of the district's Career and Technical Education Program, have completed coursework and are now IRS-Certified volunteers. They plan to assist at the PSJA sites during this tax season.

#PSJAGives

post_text:
Congratulations to our three PSJA ISD Mariachi groups for earning 1st Division Superior ratings at the UIL Region Mariachi Contest held Jan. 25 and advancing to the State competition!

Schools advancing include PSJA Early College High School, PSJA North Early College High School, and PSJA Southwest Early College High School.

“We take pride in providing quality fine arts opportunities at PSJA ISD, and are so proud of our students for this tremendous accomplishment,” said PSJA Superintendent Dr. Jorge L. Arredondo. “Thank you to our parents, teachers and administrators for their hard work and dedication.”

#PSJAProud

Did you know? Through partnerships with South Texas College and other higher education institutions, more than 3,500 PSJA ISD high school students are enrolled in college courses each semester through our nationally-recognized Early College Program. At PSJA ISD all students can earn up to two years of college FREE of cost.

Join our PSJA Family! Registration for the 2020-2021 school year starts in February.

For details or to find the school near you, visit www.psjaisd.us/register

#PSJAProud #PSJACollege4All

Congratulations to all of our amazing staff members for being named recipients of our 2019-2020 Spirit of PSJA Awards!

Our Spirit of PSJA Awards recognize individuals (regardless of role) who exemplify characteristics from our Spirit of PSJA leadership definition. The Spirit of PSJA is our district's definition of great leadership and was developed during the 2017-2018 school year through a comprehensive approach engaging several members of the PSJA Family through the process.v

Have a photo of a recipient from your school or department? Share it in the comments below.

To learn more about the Spirit of PSJA, visit https://www.psjaisd.us/Page/3272

shared_text:
PSJA Health Services is at Amanda Garza-Peña Elementary.
January 21 at 11:58 AM · San Juan, TX ·

Shotout to Nurse Elena Estevis-Sustaita for giving a CPR training to the staff at Amanda Garza-Pena Elementary this past Saturday!

Thank you for all you do! 🤩

CPR is as Easy as:

C - compression (push hard and fast on the center of the victim’s chest)

A- airway (Rolf the victim’s head back and lift the chin to open the airway)

B - breathing (give mouth to mouth reduce breathes)

CPR is as Easy as:

C - compression (push hard and fast on the center of the victim’s chest)

A- airway (Rolf the victim’s head back and lift the chin to open the airway)

B - breathing (give mouth to mouth reduce breathes)

Nominate outstanding 4th-8th graders for the summer 2020 Lone Star Leadership Academy camps!

Participants travel to the Dallas/Fort Worth, Austin/San Antonio, or Houston/Galveston area to join delegations of other distinguished students from across Texas for a week of fun, learning, leadership development, and visits to significant Texas destinations.

Nominate your outstanding 4th-8th graders online at: http://educationinaction.org/nominate-leaders

Nomination Deadline: Friday, January 31, 2020

Recruitment for our PSJA Academies starts Jan. 13!

The PSJA Academies allow students to choose from 20+ fields of study and get support as they work to obtain an Associate Degree or Certificate from South Texas College.

Students enrolled in the PSJA Academies continue to attend their home high school. They travel to the Academies' site only for designated hours for academy coursework.

Visit www.psjaisd.us/academies for more information

PSJA high school students must be nominated by high school faculty and staff.

Important: Nominations by family members are not be allowed.
