post_text: Such important lessons for our students as they grew and harvested their own vegetables as part of our PSJA Farm to School Program! 🥦🥗#onlyatPSJA
shared_text:
Berta Palacios Elementary
January 8 at 10:32 PM ·

☀️🌺🌸☀️🌺🌸☀️🌺🌸☀️🌺🌸☀️🌺
Our garden club members gathered the harvested kale and cabbage that they have grown as part of our Farm to School program in PSJA. Thank you to our science lab teacher Silvia Saldivar and Mr. Habraham Lopez for teaching our students how to plant, transplant, feed and water,harvest and pick the vegetables . Students were able to take their vegetables home to enjoy with a meal.

“Gardening adds years to your life and life to your years” 🌸 🌺

#onlyatPSJA #gardening #organic #farmtoschoolprogram

post_text:
Save the date! Registration for the 2020-2021 school year starts February 2020.

Why PSJA?
PSJA ISD is a state and national leader in creating academic opportunities for all students. As a tri-city public school district offering a pre-kindergarten through twelfth grade curriculum, PSJA caters to approximately 32,000 students and is focused on producing graduates that will be College Ready, College Connected and College Complete.

At PSJA ISD, all students can:
* Earn College Credit (up to an Associate Degree or 2 years of College FREE)
* Graduate Bilingual & Biliterate
* Be Part of Competitive Athletics & Renowned Fine Arts Programs

Find the nearest school near your home or work here: https://schoolfinder.psjaisd.us/

To learn more or register, visit www.psjaisd.us/register

post_text:
Congratulations to 8 PSJA campuses who were named recipients of the 2019-2020 Imagine Learning Math Blockbuster Awards!

Imagine Learning, which aims to provide supplemental math, language and literacy programs for preschool through high school students, hosts the annual contest as a way to highlight the campuses, classrooms and teachers who excelled in mathematics.

October:
- Henry Ford Elementary – Top School (Imagine Math PK-2)
- Graciela Garcia Elementary – Top Classroom (Imagine Math PK-2)
- Gus GuerraElementary – Top School (Imagine Math 3+)
- Kelly-Pharr Elementary – Top Classroom (Imagine Math 3+)

November:
- Aida C. Escobar Elementary School - Top School (Imagine Math PK-2)
- Zeferino Farias Elementary - Top Classroom (Imagine Math PK-2)
- Cesar Chavez Elementary - Top School (Imagine Math 3+)
- Stephen F. Austin Middle School - Top Classroom (Imagine Math 3+)

Read more: https://bit.ly/2reOOr3

Congratulations to Habraham Lopez, a PSJA Memorial Early College High School class of 2014 alum, for graduating with a Master's Degree in Agricultural, Environmental & Sustainability Sciences from UTRGV - The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley!

Mr. Lopez works in our PSJA Child Nutrition Department as our Agroecology & Sustainability Supervisor. He's played a key role in promoting healthier lifestyles among our students through the Farm to School Challenge and got to plant fruit and vegetable gardens.

Congratulations!

#PSJAProud

Congratulations to Adrina Christel Karr, PSJA Early College High School Class of 2016 Alumna, for graduating with a Bachelor of Science in Applied Learning and Development from the The University of Texas at Austin!

Adrina was a part of our Early College Program and earned an Associate Degree in Interdisciplinary Studies from South Texas College a week prior to her high school graduation in 2016. In the spring semester, she will begin her teaching career at Northside Independent School District.

Her proud parents are Mr. Adrian Karr, Carman Elementary Principal, and Mrs. Christina Telles, Clover Elementary Assistant Principal.

Know a PSJA alum who recently graduated? Share their achievement with us www.psjaisd.us/collegegrads

#PSJACollegeComplete

post_text:
Congratulations to Giselle Feliciano, 8th grader at Raul Yzaguirre Middle School, for being the winner of our districtwide 2019 Holiday Greeting Card Art Contest!

Did you know? For the last 12 years, the PSJA Communications Dept. has held this contest where the winning art piece is selected as the PSJA ISD School Board/Superintendent Holiday Greeting Card that goes out to all schools/departments, local, state and national elected officials, business partners, and supporters.

Each year a large number of paintings and drawings from all grade levels are submitted for consideration, but only the top 5 pieces chosen by Communication staff are taken to Administrators to vote on.

Thank you to Giselle and all other students who submitted their work to the contest for sharing your talent. We thank all participants and look forward to next year’s contest and their beautiful creations.

#PSJAFamily
text:
Congratulations to Giselle Feliciano, 8th grader at Raul Yzaguirre Middle School, for being the winner of our districtwide 2019 Holiday Greeting Card Art Contest!

Did you know? For the last 12 years, the PSJA Communications Dept. has held this contest where the winning art piece is selected as the PSJA ISD School Board/Superintendent Holiday Greeting Card that goes out to all schools/departments, local, state and national elected officials, business partners, and supporters.

Each year a large number of paintings and drawings from all grade levels are submitted for consideration, but only the top 5 pieces chosen by Communication staff are taken to Administrators to vote on.

Thank you to Giselle and all other students who submitted their work to the contest for sharing your talent. We thank all participants and look forward to next year’s contest and their beautiful creations.

post_text:
We are excited to be among several school districts in the RGV set to collaborate with the UTRGV - The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley on an initiative to grow leaders in special education administration!

The initiative titled, Project PLEASE (Program for Leaders to Educate and Advocate for Special Education) will prepare and train 14 district special education educators from the Rio Grande Valley to administer special education and/or early intervention programs at their school districts.

“We are honored to collaborate with UTRGV on this initiative that will have a tremendous impact on our students and families,” said PSJA Superintendent Dr. Jorge L. Arredondo. “Our PSJA Special Education Department is already a model for education in the Rio Grande Valley and this opportunity will help us further strengthen our program.”

#PSJAProud

post_text:
La preparatoria PSJA North Early College High School llevó a cabo un Zumbathón este fin de semana como parte del proyecto Capstone para ayudar a los niños necesitados.

Los participantes contribuyeron con la donación de juguetes, que luego se regalará a niños en hospitales locales, así como a organizaciones que ayudan a niños con necesidades.

#PSJAGivesBack

post_text:
Shoutout to Diego Trevino, PSJA Southwest Early College High School Alum & Freshman at the University of Oklahoma, for competing in his first collegiate competition and taking the men's title with a collegiate PR throw of 55-9 (16.99m)!

#PSJAProud

post_text:
What a special moment for one of our families! 💕

Today PSJA T. Jefferson T-Stem ECHS Senior Ayslinn Zertuche got to earn an Industry Certification as a Legal Office Specialist from South Texas College just a day after her mother Rosa fulfilled her dream of earning her GED through our PSJA Parental Engagement Program!

Mrs. Zertuche is one of our dedicated volunteers and has been attending our GED courses offered in partnership with STC.

Congratulations to both on behalf of our PSJA Family!

#PSJAProud

post_text:
Congratulations to our nearly 100 seniors participating in today's South Texas College Graduation Ceremonies to receive Associate Degrees and Industry Certifications a semester before their high school graduation!

Of 163 high school students from across the RGV named candidates for STC's Fall 2019 Commencement Ceremonies, 96 attend PSJA ISD schools!

Know a senior graduating today? Help us highlight them by sharing photos of your special graduate in the comments below.

💡 Did you know? Through partnerships with STC and other higher education leaders, more than 3,500 PSJA ISD high school students are enrolled in college courses each semester through our nationally recognized Early College Program. At PSJA ISD all students can earn up to two years of college free of cost.

To learn more about the PSJA Early College Program, visit www.psjaisd.us/earlycollege

#PSJACollegeConnected #PSJAProud
